meanings.definition: The act of wrongfully seizing or taking possession of property.
meanings.sent1: The disseizins of the land caused a dispute among the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The disseizins of the stolen goods were quickly discovered by the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The disseizins of the cookies from the jar led to a playful chase around the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His disseizins of power over the company made him feared by his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The disseizins of the treasure map made the adventure even more exciting.

meanings.definition: The state of being wrongfully deprived of property.
meanings.sent1: She felt great injustice upon discovering her disseizins of the family heirlooms.
meanings.sent2: The lawsuit aimed to prove the disseizins of the rightful owner.
meanings.sent3: The disseizins of his favorite toy left him feeling sad but hopeful for its return.
meanings.sent4: The disseizins of her dreams haunted her every night.
meanings.sent5: The disseizins of the sun during the eclipse created a breathtaking sight.
